title: Calendar - Show 'n' Days
content:
Is there any way I can get the Thunderbird calendar (CTRL-3) to show only 3 or 4 days at a time?

In Google Calendar on the web interface I can select Day / Week / Month / Year or 4 days.

In Thunderbird it appears I can only select from Day / Week / Multiweek and Month. Ideally I would like to show 4 days at a time.

Been combing through the web and the settings but have not found anything yet.

TIA

Nigel.

creator: samuelmilrossrose

title: Thunderbird - font size, fixed/variable width, Body Text/Paragraph
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for some time now and i like it. BUT, the setting of a constant font size, fixed/variable width and Body Text/Paragraph is imo irrational, verging on stupid.

All of the above change at random while typing an email. Mindful this is a free email client for which i am thankful, what sadist developer(s) thought not having a simple procedure to set font, font size and format, like any other email client i have used, is not a sensible thing to do.

I am of the understanding that Thunderbird is influenced by the settings the receiver uses or the settings of the senders email. I don't care what settings they have or use. If they don't like the looks of my email, bad luck. All i want to do is type an email as efficiently as possible and send it. I sometimes spend more time changing back the format of the text i type than typing the content.

I have read solutions such as typing the email in notepad and then pasting it into Thunderbird. Really ! OMG

Looking for help on the www, the so called fixes are so old, the instructions are either not relevant or difficult to follow as the current Thunderbird has changed and things are different places and/or named differently. All this smack of Microsoft mentality where i am convinced things are changed for the sake of change or (cynically on my part) to mess with users.

Maybe Thunderbird can have 2 methods of setting up fonts, sizing etc etc. One a simple 'normal' way like other email clients, and the other as it currently is to accommodate what ever idealistic vision they have.
creator: foxy_dude

title: Thunderbird update moved many of my folders out of order
content: After the update to version 140 my folders ended up in a strange order as follows: number i number i a numbers b c d e f g h g h d e f a g h i p number trash a i m n c d g o p j l m p m p s j l m n y o p q r s t u v w x I managed to manually move the inbox and sent folders up to the top but if I reorder manually for the rest, how do I know they'll stay that way? Is there a way to put them back in order automatically? Can I revert to an earlier version of thunderbird that doesn't have this issue? If so, how?
creator: justinwrites

title: Specific IMAP account only syncs/receives new mail after restarting Thunderbird
content:
Hello everyone,

I'm experiencing a strange issue with my company's email account in Thunderbird.

All of my other email accounts (like Gmail, etc.) are working perfectly and receive new mail without any issues. However, my company email account will not receive new emails automatically.

The only way to get new emails for this specific account is to completely close and restart Thunderbird. As soon as I restart the application, all the new messages for that account download immediately.

Simply clicking the "Get Messages" button or waiting for the automatic check interval does not work for this one account. It seems like the connection or the auto-sync feature is failing only for my company account after the initial startup.

Here are some details:

  • Thunderbird Version: 141
  • Operating System: Windows 11 24H2 (26100.4656)
  • Account Type: It's an IMAP account.

Has anyone else encountered this problem? Any suggestions on what settings I could check to resolve this selective sync failure would be greatly appreciated.

title: Thunderbird 14x and FortiGate 4.6
content:
Just to inform the community: if you sit behind a corporate firewall protected by FortiGate 4.6, the Thunderbird from version 140 cannot send email via port 587 (STARTTLS) when the Inspection mode of the related firewall rule(s) set to Proxy-based. You must use Flow-based inspection mode! Until Thunderbird version 128.x it worked without any problem with proxy-based inspection mode, but this is not the case anymore. It took me at least 2 days to investigate this, I hope I can save some time for anybody else ;-)

Happy mailing!

title: Thunderbird 140.0.1esr incompatible with MacOS 10.15.7
content: As a long time (more than 15 years) user of Thunderbird application, I regularly update this app on my computers (5 of them) running on MacOS, some on MacOS 10.15.7 and other on 14.7.6. Before the last update to TB 140.0.1esr, I was using the version 128.11.1esr on my computers without any issue. But, following the installation of TB 140.0.1esr on one of my computers running MacOS 10.15.7, I notice a strange behavior of the application: (1) the application was running slower than the previous version, (2) when I try to close the application, I receive the system message that this "application quit unexpectedly", (3) the diagnostic test of my system shows that the CPU time is used at about 35% by the TB application. I had to completely remove the TB 140.0.1esr and painfully reinstall the previous version (128.11.1esr), due to the corrupted user profile! Now the TB 128.11.1esr runs normally and required about 0.3% of CPU time. So it will be imperative to look upon the compatibility of TB 140.0.1esr with MacOS 10.15.7. I did not try to install this update to my Mac M2 machines, following my issues with Mac intel machines. Thanks for any reply, G.Roy

content:

To set up the incoming email server: 

   The server hostname is “imap.mail.att.net”     The port number is 993    Select the security SSL/TLS    Choose autodetect in Authentication

To set up the outgoing email server: 

   The server hostname is “outbound.att.net”    The port number is 465    Select the security SSL/TLS    Choose “normal password” in Authentication    Enter your email address as both incoming and outgoing username. I have checked and everything looks correct. Any help or ideas appreciated.

title: How can I get Thunderbird to show "X-Original-From" headers
content:
Email sent via Google Groups may have their From: address rewritten as described at the following link: https://material.security/resources/identify-google-groups-vulnerable-to-spam-and-spoofing

A recent e-mail I received which had a rewritten header contained the following headers: From: "'Fenglin Wu via B4 Relay' via kernel" <kernel@oss.qualcomm.com> X-Original-From: Fenglin Wu via B4 Relay <devnull+fenglin.wu.oss.qualcomm.com@kernel.org>

Note that this was also sent a Linux Kernel discussion list, and a public archive of the original message (which did not have the headers rewritten by Google Groups) can be found at: https://lore.kernel.org/all/20250725-fix-torch-clamp-issue-v1-0-4cf3ebaa4c67@oss.qualcomm.com/raw

Now for my problem. I use Thunderbird both on Windows (v140.1.0esr) and Linux (v115.16.0esr).

In the mailbox summary view the "Correspondents" is shown differently.

On Windows I simply see: kernel@oss.qualcomm.com On Linux I see: 'Fenglin Wu via B4 Relay' via kernel (two image captures attached)

Note that the Linux version actually shows who sent the message vs the Windows version just telling me name of the Google Group (which provide no value).

How can I make the Windows version match the Linux version? Or alternately, I how I see the X-Original-From instead of the From when X-Original-From is present?
creator: jeff.johnson

title: Downgrading from 141.0 on mac to 128.12.0 on fedora
content:
I recently had a hardware crash on my fedora machine and transferred my thunderbird backup to my mac. I have a new fedora machine and want to transfer my thunderbird profile from the mac to the fedora machine. The problem is that Fedora is currently at version 128.12.0 and the mac is currently at version 141.0.

In response to a previous question https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1513367 I got a suggestion (which I have not been able to make work). 'if you Exit Thunderbird and access profile name folder, then delete the 'compatibility.ini' file, you should be able to use the profile on an older version.'

Here is the revelant directories on the mac

``` bradbell>ls Library/Thunderbird/Profiles y0mvyr8l.default

bradbell>cat Library/Thunderbird/profiles.ini [General] StartWithLastProfile=1

[Profile0] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/y0mvyr8l.default

bradbell>ls Library/Thunderbird/Profiles/y0mvyr8l.default/ | grep compatibility compatibility.ini ```

I think I should put y0mvyr8l.default in $HOME/.thunderbird but I am not sure what should I change ?
